title: evening poem
text:
at dusk all the bees are in their beds
little white flowers spread over the grass
look like flecks of cocaine
soon to be hoovered up by my lawnmower
I am the stillness of the trees
and the whir of the motorway
I am the little bats
that dance around my resting head
their little wings nodding at the dead

title: two lonely children
text:
you're all talk
I'm all talk too
we dance
and dance
until our heads are spinning
just for a chance
to say that we're winning
don't look inside
to what we cover up
 two lonely children
in our hearts are stuck

title: father's day poem
text:
to dad
I write the cursive in the card
free and easy
happy father's day
I don't elaborate
I know you understate
and you'll feel it
either way
I sign my brother's name
like he did it himself
it is all done
with love

dogs bark
the day goes dark
clouds part
attention sparks
the great unknown
in my heart
a squeeky fart
is a false start
I've shat myself

title: watching old videos
text:
watching
old videos of
myself
and Tom
and Dom
and laughing so hard
at our old house
and Tom

my Mum said
"you should have both gone
to drama school"
and she's right
but instead
I'll hold
 on to all
 of us laughing
together

title: the night blue sky
text:
the night blue sky
and the gentle leaves
I write to see
I write to see
something changed
inside of me
when I wrote plain words
with a cup of tea
I step outside
to the quiet breeze
and at last I see
the night blue sky
and the gentle leaves

title: dead cat poem
text:
dead cat
black cat
at the end 
of the garden
he came into
the house
through the
backdoor

he stared
at me
with
yellow
eyes

I shooed him outside
until he was scared
looking back
at me
from the grass

he stared
at me
with
yellow eyes

I got scared
so I shot him there
his life
became one
with the night
and that's how
the dead cat
that stared
came to be buried
in the
gardens
darkness

sometimes
when
I can't sleep
I see
its eyes
they burn
through
the walls
I turn around
to look at
nothing

title: a long black at the garden centre
text:
a long black at the garden centre
Gran loves flowers
so I'll leave some on her doorstep
I travelled to the mighty land of Silverdale this morning
and left my bike at a shop called Spokes
the bloke was like me 
tired
puffy eyes widened by coffee
now the sun beams down and heals me
eases my transition
from the other side of the world
in both situations
it's just me
but Melbourne
my second home
feels like a dream
and it can feel so lonely
in my childhood bedroom
at night
I've replaced the beaches
with helping my Grandad shift furniture
for the new carpet
I've replaced the looseness of meeting fresh faces
with the tightness of seeing old friends
like a crab that can't escape it's shell
when I return home I encounter
my old self
but relax! I say
I've just got back
it's spring here
and I know deep down the world only turns one way
each moment is ripe and fresh
like the tender buds that grow on the trees
it's like i've never experienced spring before
because now I look at the budding trees
and I really feel it deep down
like I could cry
what I'm trying to say is
I've changed
and all I really need is time

title: ﻿dishes
text:
the children's screaming
like venemous sheeps (in the peaks)
has stopped (a sweet relief)


the torture of car insurance
now complete (despite various depressions)
has stopped (have I learnt my lesson?)
 
car rentals and day jobs 
are still on the table 
I am still 
mentally unstable 
sort of
but I'm not going to take anymore pish
since I have to clean this dish 
I stand in the kitchen while the fallen soldiers 
plant pots and sabres
scars and knives 
they all stare at me with 
eyes like the heads of nails 


but the sun is gleaming
and a strange light calls me
but still I am haunted 
by the brilliance of robert walser


all the dishes were done in 5 minutes

title: pub poem
text:
the bells chime across the eternal tiled floor
a distant grandfather clock ticks in the backroom
the waitress teases me with looks
that I half imagine
running back and forth between the nooks and crannies
I resist looking back 
but how I would like to unlock her 
her skinny legs with no meat on them
I would lay in my victorian bed 
and those feet would touch me
as cold as a cadaver 
in this pub many strange people come and go
I sip my coffee 
fireplace to my left
trying to look interesting
waiting for something beautiful
to happen to me

title: norwegian prose poem
text: the old norwegians said that life was a misery of sorts, and that nature itself was working against them. don't get them started on love and women. but I look up at the sky and feel awe and love. there's lilacs and blues in the sky. the clouds are an assortment of fossils and skimming stones. a lone birds flies overhead and pirrouhettes. from a long lineage, after a very long time, people like me now have the space to exist and to heal.

title: my return to london
text:
the wellcome reading room 
ucl campus
gordon square garden in the sun 
full of students 
the pretty buildings 
the soas hitler building 
and the soas hare kirshna area
whispers of memories on gower street 
the lord chancellor sign on bloomsbury street
avoiding tottenham court road 
james smith and sons umbrellas 
a group of tourists enjoying a beer at craft beer company 
covent garden 
the cross keys 
smell the history of the amazingly cosy little pub!
the royal opera house 
moving across to soho with the somber piano tones 
thinking of billy childish kicking jonny rotten
down in the street 
the marquis off of william 4 street 
a cool interior and everyone drinking with glass outside!
they trust em!
chandos with the beautiful stain glass windows and cosy nooks!
a girl with a top that says
I'm your dream girls dream girl 
and now I'm here at the national portrait gallery 
about to see some munch paintings for the first time 
I'll try and get rid of all expectation and thinking 
and remember we're all following the inner guide 
oh and st james park in 5 pm sunshine

title: on the avanti west coast train to glasgow
text:
it's raining outside
but always sunny in my head 


I see myself on the camera and
question
where does all the cctv go?


more creating
 and letting it go 
less criticising it
and chastising it 


as the glorious greens of the countryside 
pour into my dream cup


three cheers for 
less control 
and
what comes 
what comes 
what comes 
what comes!

title: the beauty of elwood streets
text:
the beauty of elwood streets 
and green fields
and yellow flowers
makes me cry


things ending 
and my whole being supporting me
makes me cry


seeing my friends for the last time
and a child's painting
makes me cry 


I guess we just don't know how lucky we are

title: untitled
text:
feeling sort've sick 
returning to the fire 
I was the lone occupant of the manor house 
wandering around empty rooms
hands crossed behind his back
but now I return to the fire
and I remember what it's like to feel love
and I feel caution
and I feel sick 
I feel young 
I want to cry
part of me needs to temper it though

title: say yes
text:
standing on bus stop trolleys
cycling on curbs with a flat tire 
having someone say yes
makes me dumb happy
dancing through the streets like a new film 
new promises
and the old fear 
to let someone know
and to have them reciprocate it
to even suggest it
is exquisite 
to exist
and to let all the songs
sing in my heart

title: electric shoulder touch
text:
electric shoulder touch
promise 
dash of raspberry cordial
guinness poured poorly
all the while 
I long to touch you back 
however incidental
a gentle movement
a brush past
instead 
we talk and laugh 
and the electricity 
of that touch 
fades
halted by the fleeting moment
we embrace 
and let the 
scarlet wishbone
break

title: untitled
text:
the orange and brown leaves
 have fallen 
in elwood streets 
the avenues of trees
and the warm winds
when I see you it's with open mind
space to be 
and the greek girl at the bakery
what is her mystery
the secret story
of her
internal 
life

title: my bloody valentine
text:
I'll never
be able
to listen to 
my bloody valentine
the same 
again


life changed 


singing to the empty streets 
I'll be your plastic toy 
I'll be your plastic toy
I'll be your plastic toy
I'll be your plastic toy

title: the last of my weed
text:
I threw the last of my weed away
laid it out in my palm flat
and offered it to the fat horizon 
to the grey sea
to the little fishies
and to bob marley
against the wicked wind


cannabis
you have grown tiresome 
stuck playing the same note


I throw it far into the waves and it plops and it's gone
suddenly like northern lights an apparition shines up towards me


with extreme steadfastness
I shake myself off and rub my schnozzle
fasten me coat
and begin the long journey home
against the wicked wind

title: melbourne park poem
text:
I sink into the grass
because I am the fields and grass
my limbs spread across acres 
of cheshire oaks 
I feel at one with the pigeons
I offer up my coconut cake
by laying it at their pink feet
and jerky little heads
then lounge back 
eating my orange like a panther
sunning itself
slothfully savouring the fresh juices 
and I realise that I'm totally grateful
to my work colleagues for
not including me
this bringing forth my hatred 
and my bitterness 
so I can meet it 
with tenderness 
so that it cracks like a rock
and my soul emerges

title: drinking problem
text:
in life you have to give yourself 
hangover
arms open
second coffee
I will stop drinking 
I will stop
the neon empty promises
the sex dreams on sticky floors
I want to 
peer behind the 
beer mat
take a deep breath
and see the cockroaches
 scurry when the lights
come on
surrender to nights alone
lime and soda
surrounded by throes of people 
stuck in white heat 
all so I can give more
of myself 
to the people 
I care about
for everything 
in the 
world
I want to
 give 
all of 
me

title: hangover poem
text:
I am a sensitive boy
so wanting to be included
but when it comes
I push it away 
the group today
especially feels my
derision 
because
I'm hungover 
I don't like pandering 
and fawning 
I sit and watch 
my manager display
it in 
droves 
the secret alliances 
and barriers 
marked out 
to keep mouths 
complicit and silent 
to outsiders 
the sound of nasal laughter
from inside the walls 
makes me 
feel sick


it might 
just be 
the 8 
pints

title: to my panicked part
text:
to my panicked part
I know you feel so alone 
but you aren't anymore 
I'm sorry I wasn't here for so long
but I didn't know
now in 2024 
I come as your friend 
I want to be your best friend
the insurmountable task
I can do them 
we can keep reminding each other 
we're here
until things are free and easy 
I want to go through it all
with you 
listen to old jazz records with you 
dream of the amalfi coast with you…

title: afca poem
text:
I walk 
with my white coffee cup
happily passing all my city chums
with their own white cups 


matcha green tea 
bianca the red haired sycophant
sucking up to the cool crew 
as I watch


I breath
I block
I blame


please take a seat 
the manager 
says into the microphone 
take responsibility 
I think 
as I park my bum 
at the 
operational excellence
annual 
get together

title: untitled
text:
so many
girls
to fall
in 
love with 
I didn't write 
enough
love 
poems 
I was 
in love 
with 
my own 
headaches

title: call to arms
text:
depressed?
anxious?
ptsd?
call me! 
time to reign it in fellas 
stop beating your wives!
stop beating yourselves over the head with a rusty kalashnikov 
hug your wife!
hug your children!
thank the postman
try a therapist on medicare and expand your life!
expand your wife's love for the world!
don't leave her
make love to her
 
fuck her really good like it's the last time!
one day it really will be the last time 
so pretend it's today!
and don't be scared to be the first one 
that's kind and tender
and loving
we need more love in the world!
together we don't have to get swept up
in our antisocial compulsions!
otherwise it's nil by mouth!
and your children and your children's children
and your nan and your uncle tom and even your own dear mother
everyone dead and alive you hold dear
will be travelling on a merry go round of shit and despair
for a very long time 
thank you

title: untitled
text:
in my girls new room
it's too intimate
and it hurts 
I dive right in 
the perxukiaruties of a good break up 
and no toxicity 
you dive back in 
she tells me to not think about it 


something that doesn't sound professional. but charming 


is this why we're growing up
to drink wine with our food
is this why I'm writing this 
to imagine quips I never sent to you 
it touches me to think of you sleeping here in the cold

title: breakup poem
text:
you are
sunshine
on red brick
terraces


you were mine
a slow
resonant 
note


but
but
and
above all 


you are 
a cold bright 
morning 
that lives in my
heart
forever

title: your look back
text:
even broken up 
we secretly sometimes meet
I don't care what anyone says about it not being healthy 
I want to see you 
we drink mulled wine 
and have a wandering sort of day 
in crisp winter cold 
you are the human being I am most comfortable with
even on a fresh hangover 


the wine goes to our heads
I rest my hand on your thigh under the table 
it makes me sad
the night feels strange and empty
apart from the touch of your hand 
your cheek
we say goodbye at the pub 
you walk away
but you looked back
you looked back 
and I hope to have that sweet joyous smile of yours 
uniquely yours 
etched into my memory 
for a long long time

title: fucking cunt
text:
fucking cunt
fucking cunt
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt 
fucking cunt

title: untitled
text:
sitting on the floor
saying hello to the flies 
sleepy but cracked open
lush grass relaxed 
the songs in my head feel different


although the demon sue haunts me 
with taunts of being an evil child 
and a "golden balls" simultaneously
like I could hold both ideals without cracking 
sue
you contributed to my negative self image
reckon with that through your many 
empty hangovers 
and your son who ran away from you to australia 


my mother said to me
that she's so sorry 
I had to go through what I did 
that she still feels like it's all her fault
and the tears I'm crying 
are the only raindrops
this island has ever seen


I reply that we're in it together
that I feel so much better after talking to her 
and the tears I'm crying 
are the only raindrops
this island has ever seen
let them flow from my cheek
in sweet release
and flow down to the lush grass
as my body relaxed

title: untitled
text:
I scoff my sushi to hide 
that I'm nervous and hurtie
6 dollars for four rolls of sushi 
prices unheard of on the british isles 
spicy tuna, terriyaki chicken
californian
and pork katsu 
I scoff to the gods
but the chit chat around me
has invisible subtexts
sinister 
as the tempura smacks between my lips 
I hear dark utterances
that say
you are not welcome here
but I stand tall
a statue of mossy stone 
my head reaches to the overcast sky 
the same heavy clouds in my stomach
leak rain from my eyes 
I stand as a writer that no one understands 
my brilliance falls short and is never heard
I stand before you a victim 
of the wicked and cowardly brads
 
we all have a brad in our lives
brad who won't cast his long lanky arms
around me
brad with his knuckles taut and strong 
wrapped around my neck 
dirty little brad
a silence 
then
   - did anyone go to the secret rave?
someone says
   - it wasn't so secret if everyone was posting about it on instagram 
brad scoffs
then he whispers to his friend 
right in front of us 
tell us the gossip brad!
I demand to hear it brad
and I realise how different I am to all these little oinks 
they walk away without any glances towwrds me
the sky rains deeply
no one loves me
not even brad


far from being sucked off 
the wound inside me sucks me in 
it sucks my love and my attention 
locks them away
and colours my life 
a pint of blood poured into all your evians 
drink piss and bitter tears


I actually made this poem to voice how you feel
so you are heard
and seen


I later learn that brad is gay maybe
so maybe I'll just bum his head off 
that'll shut him up 


we all have inner chambers of hurt 
looks are deceiving 
we can't presume because there is a constellation of parts in all of us 
inner dungeons 
but let's turn them into shag carpets 
with ifs is there any mystery left inside us ?
surely I don't know everything but but I feel like I do 
and hobbiton valleys 
the cosy feeling brings a tear to your eye
because you feel it is so far off 
but with my imagination 
I can help you...
I am here
I am with you 
it's just that others are more on show

title: the second place
text:
working on the floor
is like doing a silent buddhist retreat
it's too loud to talk
so I wander around the pub
collecting glasses
I yearn for the laughter of the bartenders
but I'm just a lowly 
food and beverage attendant 


I take a look around me
an autistic japanese couple
are bobbing their heads up and down
running about the place 
an older couple on the dancefloor 
are grinding so much
it would make usher blush
a beautiful spanish girl
has a poke at a ball with a pool cue
then looks dejected
the islander bouncer vilo
stares off into space
waiting for the night to be over 


later 
I take the bar mats downstairs 
to a dirty smelly corner 
the underground of the shopping centre 
I hang each one up with gloves
and the black residue from the mats 
drips onto my shoes and trousers
then I wash them down with a hose 


in between cleaning
a broken pigeon flutters down
and drinks from the disgusting pool of liquid 
left by the mats
my friend
a recognition
second place 
then I shoo it away

title: untitled
text:
all these people 
going to die 
in the sunshine 
I can't plan anything 
listening to the durutti column 
on my cycle into work
giving each face it's fair share
of attention 
at least I have you to hold me
and calm me down
at least I have you

title: red wine and a 50th birthday
text:
I'm fucking knackered me
sipping a beautiful big round red wine
trying to watch my glasses
but they slip and slip 
and here comes with a force
the serious writer man
inclined to disparage himself
as cold and serious 
huff puff 
well fuck that
grease is on the radio 
and I'm drinking through the campness
while I was once hesitant
now I am very excited to receive visitors
and I look forward to this weekend
andy's 50th!
so many incredible moments
bubbling through my head
in visioons
but I'll try and not to control it all
I will have the vape handy to take everything
to the next level

title: tiny climbing frame
text:
my tiny climbing frame
that once appeared so tall
goes up to my chest 
there's dinner cooking
in the streets of the westlands
and the trees...
how many stories
this whole area used to be trees and forests
until we got greedy and
fucked nature over 
the vast sky has cleared after rain
dripped away any dirt
leading to looseness 
as the children inside me scream
when I make contact
my back gives out from the pressure
tired of walking tall and stiff
for too long 
but I'm okay
I'm in love with the sky
and my parts 
the ones who need my help
and calming down 
cuddled in a blanket of clouds 
and caressed by the sun 
I will be there

title: does jonathan richman shave his pubes?
text:
does jonathan richman
shave his pubes?
he looks like a hairy lad 
what a beautiful boy
but if he dislikes the internet
and screw top wine
there is no chance 
that down there
is trimmed and fine
I love you jonathan

title: trees
text:
a lot of poems I did write
when I look back at
the end of my life
as I look at the trees
up high 
inhaling vape smoke 
I can't say no
the trees encode hidden messages
I want to explore myself
for the rest of my life
regardless of my job
or status
my holy communion 
with the trees of the three parks
in the stillness 
that's what it's all about

title: growth
text:
these past few weeks 
I have toiled with myself
crying on public footpaths
and feeling at one with the grey misty clouds 
I have carried a burden 
that makes me scared of the dark
and so alone 
sitting in my childhood house
with constant reminders 
everywhere
after much deliberation
attempts at meditation 
I found a book at just the right time
and all blames turned into one
finally I felt like I could unpack 
how I was feeling
and express it to my partner
in a calm, loving way
without setting off any bombs 
I wait for her response 
with my heart in my mouth 
for fear of conflict 
instead of ignoring it
I speak for this fear too
and how much lighter I feel
having my say
finally making a case
for the little parts inside me
the ones that are scared at being shouted at
the ones that are independent 
and ready for adventure
with my eyes open 
staring at nothing
I listen to their needs and wants 
instead of shutting them down
or worse
exiling them 
I make these cases humbly
to my girlfriend 
acknowledging my own part to play
in the misery
I can do all this
because I now feel safe 
in the boundaries 
of this relationship

title: cous cous
text:
you always
wanted 
me to
love
myself
now 
I'm crying
eating cous cous
the simplicity 
of it
it's our dish
how can this 
set me off
and the songs
and random images
of us 
living peacefully
in chorlton
you reach into
the fridge
we watch tv 
on the sofa
part of me 
screams 
no I don't 
want this 
to end
